column2: qŭóniam bonus est psalmus~; Deo nostro sit jucùnda
column3: decóraqŭe laŭdáțio. ^ Praise ye the Lord
column4: because psalm is good~; to our God be joyful and comely praise.

column1: 2 ^ Aedìficans Jerúsalim Dòminus~; dispersiónes Israhélis congregábit. ^ The Lord buildeth up Jerusalem~; he will gather together the dispersed of Israel.

column2: et alligat contrițiónes eórum. ^ Who healeth the broken of heart
et òmnibus eîs nómina vocat. ^ Who telleth the number of the stars
column3: and calleth them all by their names.
et sapiènțiaĕ ejus non est númerus. ^ Great is our Lord
column5: and of his wisdom there is no number.

column1: 6 ^ Suscìpiens mansuétos Dòminus~; humìlians aŭtem peccatóres usqŭe ad terram. ^ The Lord lifteth up the meek~; the wicked however he bringeth down unto the ground.
7 ^ Praĕcìnite Dòmino in confessióne~; psállite Deo nostro in cìttara. ^ Sing ye to the Lord with praise~; sing to our God upon the harp.

column2: et parat terraĕ plúviam~; qŭi prodúcit in mòntibus foĕnum
column3: et herbam servitúti hòminum~; ^ Who covereth the heaven with clouds
column4: and provideth rain to the earth~; who maketh grass to grow on the mountains
column5: and herbs for the service of men~;

column2: et pullîs corvórum invocántibus eum. ^ who giveth to beasts their food
column3: and to the young ravens that call upon him.

column1: 10 ^ Non in fortitúdine èqŭi voluntátem habébit
column2: nec in tíbiîs vìri beneplácitum èrit ei. ^ He shall not delight in the strength of the horse
column3: nor take pleasure in the legs of a man.

column1: 11 ^ Beneplácitum est Dòmino super timèntes eum
column2: et in eîs qŭi sperant super misericórdia ejus. ^ The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear him
column3: and in them that hope in his mercy.
